member.name: T:MsgPack.Serialization.MessagePackSerializer`1
member.summary: Defines base contract for object serialization.

remarks.para: This class implements strongly typed serialization and deserialization.
When the underlying stream does not contain strongly typed or contains dynamically typed objects, you should use directly and take advantage of .

member.name: T:MsgPack.Serialization.DefaultConcreteTypeRepository
member.summary: Repository of known concrete collection type for abstract collection type.

member.name: M:MsgPack.Serialization.DefaultConcreteTypeRepository.Get(System.Type)
member.summary: Gets the default type for the collection.
member.returns: Type of default concrete collection. If concrete collection type of , then returns null.
member.remarks:
By default, following types are registered:
Abstract Collection Type Concrete Default Collection Type
(.NET 4 or lator)
of .
of .
of .

member.name: M:MsgPack.Serialization.DefaultConcreteTypeRepository.Register(System.Type,System.Type)
member.summary: Registers the default type of the collection.
member.exception: is not collection type. Or is abstract class or interface. Or is open generic type but is closed generic type. Or is closed generic type but is open generic type. Or does not have same arity for . Or is not assignable to or the constructed type from will not be assignable to the constructed type from .
member.remarks:
If you want to overwrite default type for collection interfaces, you can use this method. Note that this method only supports collection interface, that is subtype of the interface.
If you register invalid type for , then runtime exception will be occurred. For example, you register of and pair, but it will cause runtime error.

member.name: M:MsgPack.Serialization.DefaultConcreteTypeRepository.Unregister(System.Type)
member.summary: Unregisters the default type of the collection.
member.returns: true if default collection type is removed successfully; otherwise, false.

member.returns: A deserialized value.

member.name: F:MsgPack.Serialization.EmitterFlavor.ContextBased
member.summary: Uses in each case of the members (de)serialization. It may cause more contentions but is available in WP7.

member.summary: Caches serializers for the members (de)serialization. It is default.

member.name: F:MsgPack.Serialization.EmitterFlavor.ExpressionBased
member.summary: Uses expression tree to (de)serialization. It may have more overhead but is available in WinRT.

member.remarks: If the collection has .ctor(int capacity), then it will be returned. Otherwise, default constructor will be returned. Note that this method cannot determine whether a single parameter truely represents 'capacity' or not.

member.name: F:MsgPack.Serialization.NilImplication.MemberDefault
member.summary: A nil is interpreted as default value of the member.

remarks.para: If the unpacking value is nil, the serializer will not set any value to the member.
This value corresponds to optional on the IDL.
remarks.note: This is default option because the most safe option.

member.name: F:MsgPack.Serialization.NilImplication.Null
member.summary: A nil is interpreted as null.

remarks.para: If the unpacking value is nil, the serializer will set null to the member. If the member is non-nullable value type and the packed value is nil, then will be thrown.
This value corresponds to nullable required on the IDL.
remarks.note: If the destination end point sends nil for the value type member like type, you can avoid the exception with change the type of the member to nullable value type.

remarks.para: This value affects both of serialization and deserialization.
If the packing value is null or the unpacking value is nil, the serializer will throw exception.
This value corresponds to required on the IDL.
remarks.note: When you specify this value to newly added member, it means that you BREAK backword compatibility.

member.name: T:MsgPack.Serialization.Reflection.TracingILGenerator
member.summary: like IL stream builder with tracing.

member.name: M:MsgPack.Serialization.Reflection.TracingILGenerator.EmitGetProperty(System.Reflection.PropertyInfo)
member.summary: Emit property getter invocation. Pre condition is there is target instance on the top of evaluation stack when is instance property. Post condition are that target instance will be removed from the stack for instance property, and property value will be placed on there.

member.name: M:MsgPack.Serialization.Reflection.TracingILGenerator.EmitGetType
member.summary: Emit invocation. Pre condition is that target instance is placed on the top of evaluation stack. Post condition is that target instance will be replaced with of it.

member.name: M:MsgPack.Serialization.Reflection.TracingILGenerator.EmitStringFormat(System.Int32,System.String,System.Action{MsgPack.Serialization.Reflection.TracingILGenerator}[])
member.param: Index of temporary local variable index to store param array for . Note that the type of local variable must be Object[].

List of delegates to emittion of loading formatting parameter loading instruction. Index of this array corresponds to index of formatting parameter. 1st argument is this instance. Post condition is that exactly one storing element will be added on the top of evaluation stack.

member.name: M:MsgPack.Serialization.Reflection.TracingILGenerator.EmitStringFormat(System.Int32,System.Type,System.String,System.Action{MsgPack.Serialization.Reflection.TracingILGenerator}[])

member.name: M:MsgPack.Serialization.Reflection.TracingILGenerator.EmitLdargThis
member.summary: Emit load 'this' pointer instruction (namely 'ldarg.0'). Post condition is that the loaded value will be added on the evaluation stack.

member.name: M:MsgPack.Serialization.Reflection.TracingILGenerator.EmitAnyLdarg(System.Int32)
member.summary: Emit apprpriate 'ldarg.*' instruction. Post condition is that the loaded value will be added on the evaluation stack.
member.param: Index of argument to be fetched.

member.name: M:MsgPack.Serialization.Reflection.TracingILGenerator.EmitAnyLdloc(System.Int32)
member.summary: Emit apprpriate 'ldloc.*' instruction. Post condition is that the loaded value will be added on the evaluation stack.
member.param: Index of local variable to be fetched.

member.name: M:MsgPack.Serialization.Reflection.TracingILGenerator.EmitAnyStloc(System.Int32)
member.summary: Emit array initialization code with initializer. Pre condition is that the storing value is placed on the top of evaluation stack and its type is valid. Post condition is that the stored value will be removed from the evaluation stack.
member.param: Index of local variable which stores the array.

member.name: M:MsgPack.Serialization.Reflection.TracingILGenerator.EmitNewarr(System.Type,System.Int64)
member.summary: Emit array initialization code without initializer. Post condition is evaluation stack will no be modified as previous state. Note that initialized array is not placed on the top of evaluation stack.
member.param: of array element. This can be generaic parameter.

member.name: M:MsgPack.Serialization.Reflection.TracingILGenerator.EmitNewarr(System.Int32,System.Type,System.Action{MsgPack.Serialization.Reflection.TracingILGenerator}[])
member.summary: Emit array initialization code with initializer. Post condition is evaluation stack will no be modified as previous state. Note that initialized array is not placed on the top of evaluation stack.
member.param: Index of local variable which stores the array.
of array element. This can be generaic parameter.

List of delegates to emittion of storing element loading instruction. Index of this array corresponds to index of initializing array. 1st argument is this instance. Post condition is that exactly one storing element will be added on the top of stack and its type is compatible.

member.name: M:MsgPack.Serialization.Reflection.TracingILGenerator.EmitNewarr(System.Action{MsgPack.Serialization.Reflection.TracingILGenerator},System.Action{MsgPack.Serialization.Reflection.TracingILGenerator},System.Type,System.Action{MsgPack.Serialization.Reflection.TracingILGenerator}[])
member.summary: Emit array initialization code with initializer. Post condition is evaluation stack will no be modified as previous state. Note that initialized array is not placed on the top of evaluation stack.
member.param: Delegate to emittion of array loading instruction. 1st argument is this instance. Post condition is that exactly one target array will be added on the top of stack and element type is .

Delegate to emittion of array storing instruction. 1st argument is this instance. Pre condition is that the top of evaluation stack is array type and its element type is . Post condition is that exactly one target array will be removed from the top of stack.
of array element. This can be generaic parameter.

List of delegates to emittion of storing element loading instruction. Index of this array corresponds to index of initializing array. 1st argument is this instance. Post condition is that exactly one storing element will be added on the top of stack and its type is compatible.

member.param: of array element. This can be generaic parameter.

member.name: M:MsgPack.Serialization.Reflection.TracingILGenerator.EmitAnyStelem(System.Type,System.Action{MsgPack.Serialization.Reflection.TracingILGenerator},System.Int64,System.Action{MsgPack.Serialization.Reflection.TracingILGenerator})
member.summary: Emit array element storing instructions. Post condition is evaluation stack will no be modified as previous state.

Delegate to emittion of array loading instruction. 1st argument is this instance. Post condition is that exactly one target array will be added on the top of stack and its element type is .

Delegate to emittion of storing element loading instruction. 1st argument is this instance. Post condition is that exactly one storing element will be added on the top of stack and its type is compatible.

member.name: M:MsgPack.Serialization.Reflection.TracingILGenerator.EmitLiteralInteger(System.Int64)
member.summary: Emit efficient integer constant loading. Post condition is that exactly one integer will be added on the top of stack.

member.name: M:MsgPack.Serialization.Reflection.TracingILGenerator.EmitTypeOf(System.Type)
member.summary: Emit 'typeof' expression. Post condition is instance for will be placed on the top of evaluation stack.

member.name: M:MsgPack.Serialization.Reflection.TracingILGenerator.EmitThrowNewArgumentExceptionWithInnerException
member.summary: Emit 'throw new ArgumentException(String,String,Exception)' statement. Pre condition is that there are exactly three entries in the evaluation stack, which are string, string, and Exception instance. Post condition is that the evaluation statck will be empty.

member.name: M:MsgPack.Serialization.Reflection.TracingILGenerator.EmitThrowNewExceptionWithInnerException(System.Type)
member.summary: Emit 'throw new TException(String,String,Exception)' statement. Pre condition is that there are exactly two entries in the evaluation stack, which are string and Exception instance. Post condition is that the evaluation statck will be empty.

member.summary: Emit exception block with catch blocks.
member.param: which emits exception block (try in C#) body. A 1st argument is this , and a 2nd argument is will to be end of emitting exception block. The delegate do not have to emit leave or leave.s instrauction at tail of the body.

for catch block body emittion. A 1st item of the tuple is which indicates catching exception type. A 2nd item of the tuple is which emits catch block body. A 1st argument of the delegate is this , a 2nd argument of the delegate is will to be end of emitting exception block, and 3rd argument of the delegate is the 1st item of the tuple. The delegate do not have to emit leave or leave.s instrauction at tail of the body.

for catch block body emittion. A 1st item of the tuple is which indicates catching exception type. A 2nd item of the tuple is which emits catch block body. A 1st argument of the delegate is this , a 2nd argument of the delegate is will to be end of emitting exception block, and 3rd argument of the delegate is the 1st item of the tuple. The delegate do not have to emit leave or leave.s instrauction at tail of the body.

member.summary: Emit exception block with catch blocks and a finally block.
member.param: which emits exception block (try in C#) body. A 1st argument is this , and a 2nd argument is will to be end of emitting exception block. The delegate do not have to emit leave or leave.s instrauction at tail of the body.

which emits finally block body. A 1st argument is this , and a 2nd argument is will to be end of emitting exception block. The delegate do not have to emit endfinally instrauction at tail of the body.

for catch block body emittion. A 1st item of the tuple is which indicates catching exception type. A 2nd item of the tuple is which emits catch block body. A 1st argument of the delegate is this , a 2nd argument of the delegate is will to be end of emitting exception block, and 3rd argument of the delegate is the 1st item of the tuple. The delegate do not have to emit leave or leave.s instrauction at tail of the body.

member.returns: instance. It will not be null.

member.name: M:MsgPack.Serialization.SerializationExceptions.NewIsNotMapHeader
member.summary: This is intended to MsgPack for CLI internal use. Do not use this type from application directly. Returns new exception to notify that unpacker is not in the array header, that is the state is invalid.
member.returns: instance. It will not be null.

member.name: M:MsgPack.Serialization.SerializationExceptions.NewNotSupportedBecauseCannotInstanciateAbstractType(System.Type)
member.summary: This is intended to MsgPack for CLI internal use. Do not use this type from application directly. Returns new exception to notify that operation is not supported because cannot be instanciated.
member.returns: instance. It will not be null.

member.name: M:MsgPack.Serialization.SerializationExceptions.NewTupleCardinarityIsNotMatch(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: This is intended to MsgPack for CLI internal use. Do not use this type from application directly. Returns new exception to notify that the array length does not match to expected tuple cardinality.
member.param: The expected cardinality of the tuple.
member.returns: instance. It will not be null.

member.name: M:MsgPack.Serialization.SerializationExceptions.NewIsIncorrectStream(System.Exception)
member.summary: This is intended to MsgPack for CLI internal use. Do not use this type from application directly. Returns new exception to notify that the underlying stream is not correct semantically because failed to unpack items count of array/map.
member.param: The inner exception for the debug. The value is implementation specific.
member.returns: instance. It will not be null.

member.name: M:MsgPack.Serialization.SerializationExceptions.NewIsTooLargeCollection
member.summary: This is intended to MsgPack for CLI internal use. Do not use this type from application directly. Returns new exception to notify that the unpacking collection is too large to represents in the current runtime environment.
member.returns: instance. It will not be null.

member.name: M:MsgPack.Serialization.SerializationExceptions.NewEmptyOrUnstartedUnpacker
member.summary: This is intended to MsgPack for CLI internal use. Do not use this type from application directly. Returns new exception to notify that the the unpacker does not contain any data because the underlying stream is empty or unpacker has not been started.
member.returns: instance. It will not be null.

member.name: M:MsgPack.Serialization.SerializationExceptions.NewNullIsProhibited(System.String)
member.summary: This is intended to MsgPack for CLI internal use. Do not use this type from application directly. Returns new exception to notify that the member cannot be null or the unpacking value cannot be nil because nil value is explicitly prohibitted.
member.returns: instance. It will not be null.

member.name: M:MsgPack.Serialization.SerializationExceptions.NewReadOnlyMemberItemsMustNotBeNull(System.String)
member.summary: This is intended to MsgPack for CLI internal use. Do not use this type from application directly. Returns new exception to notify that the unpacking value cannot be nil because the target member is read only and its type is collection.
member.returns: instance. It will not be null.

member.name: M:MsgPack.Serialization.SerializationExceptions.NewStreamDoesNotContainCollectionForMember(System.String)
member.summary: This is intended to MsgPack for CLI internal use. Do not use this type from application directly. Returns new exception to notify that the unpacking collection value is not a collection.
member.returns: instance. It will not be null.

member.name: M:MsgPack.Serialization.SerializationExceptions.NewUnexpectedArrayLength(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: This is intended to MsgPack for CLI internal use. Do not use this type from application directly. Returns new exception to notify that the unpacking array size is not expected length.
member.param: Expected, required for deserialization array length.
member.returns: instance. It will not be null.

member.name: M:MsgPack.Serialization.SerializationExceptions.NewFailedToDeserializeMember(System.Type,System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: This is intended to MsgPack for CLI internal use. Do not use this type from application directly. Returns new exception to notify that it is failed to deserialize member.
member.param: The name of the deserializing member.
The exception which caused current error.
member.returns: instance. It will not be null.

member.name: T:MsgPack.Serialization.SerializationMethod
member.summary: Represents serialization method for complex types.

member.name: F:MsgPack.Serialization.SerializationMethod.Array
member.summary: The object will be serialized as array which is ordered by member ID. This is default and more interoperable option.

member.name: F:MsgPack.Serialization.SerializationMethod.Map
member.summary: The object will be serialized as map which is ordered by member ID. This is a bit slower than array, but more stable for forward/backward compatibility.

member.name: F:MsgPack.Serialization.SerializationMethodGeneratorOption.Fast
member.summary: Prefer performance. This options is default.
